page.title: 19THE MURSTON BRICKWORKS
page.content: {THE MURSTON BRICKWORKS Our school was built in one of the pits where they used to dig brick- earth.We call it the Hollow.The brick- works first opened in the C18th and most of the older houses in Murston used to be rented by brickworkers.The bricks are still stamped S.D.for Smeed-Dean,the original owners.The works are now run by Blue Circle Industries and the number of employees who work there is 53.Their wages are Â£100 per week.The average number of bricks made in an hour is 1400 and on an 8 hour shift 11200.The brickworks runs on gas and the Burner has been there 5 years. {COST OF BRICKS. London stock Â£260 per thousand bricks. Second hards Â£240 per thousand bricks. Milds Â£212 per thousand bricks. Roughs Â£200 per thousand bricks.
